section.title: BackStage
section.para: BackStage is a Sinatra app that you may deploy within TorqueBox to get additional views and control into your application's components.

formalpara.title: Destinations
formalpara.para: Enumerate and interrogate messaging queues and topics. Allows browsing of messages within queues.

formalpara.title: Message Processors
formalpara.para: Control message processors, including pausing their execution.

formalpara.title: Ruby Runtime Pools
formalpara.para: View information about the runtime pools for all applications. Allows arbitrary script execution within a runtime from a pool.

section.title: More Information
section.para: More Information About Backstage May Be Found On The Torquebox Website. The Source For Backstage Is Hosted At Github.

section.title: StompBox
section.para: StompBox enables easy Git-based deployments to a TorqueBox AS.
By using a post-commit POST-back hook, StompBox is able to check your application code out of the repository and deploy it into the running server.

formalpara.title: Deploy via Git
formalpara.para: Using POST-back hooks, deploy code using git push.

formalpara.title: Multiple Revisions
formalpara.para: Roll forward or backward through revisions of your application code.

section.title: More Information
section.para: More Information About StompBox May Be Found On The TorqueBox Website. The Source For StompBox Is Hosted At Github.
